Lack enough support: The claim that Salman Khurshid wants to challenge the Delhi High Court verdict on Sajjan Kumar is based on information received by AAP leader Jarnail Singh. However, there is no concrete evidence or statement from Salman Khurshid to support this claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Salman Khurshid wants to challenge the verdict and defend Sajjan Kumar based on the information received by AAP leader Jarnail Singh. However, there is no direct statement or confirmation from Salman Khurshid to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim made by AAP leader Jarnail Singh and reported by Catch News and ANI may have an alternative explanation. Salman Khurshid himself has denied making any statement regarding challenging the verdict, and it was later revealed that the statement attributed to him was concocted by a parody handle.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Salman Khurshid has denied making any statement regarding challenging the verdict. He mentioned that he hasn't even read the judgement yet.
Understate: It is possible that the claim may be understating the situation by suggesting that Salman Khurshid wants to challenge the verdict without providing sufficient evidence or confirmation from him.
Exaggerate: There is no clear evidence of any exaggeration in the claim.
